hypothesis_content.title: Market Maker Liquidity Gap Fade
hypothesis_content.statement: When major exchanges announce market maker liquidity enhancements (like Crypto.com's recent announcement) during NEUTRAL regimes, the paired asset (ETH/BTC in this case) shows a predictable fade pattern: initial 1.2% pump within 2 hours, followed by full retrace within 6 hours.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Liquidity announcements create temporary arbitrage opportunities that get quickly filled. Market makers test new ranges but revert as actual flow doesn't match anticipated demand. ETH/BTC pairs particularly sensitive to exchange-specific news.
entry_conditions: News event: Major exchange announces market maker liquidity program
ETH/BTC ratio shows immediate spike >0.8% within 30 minutes of news
Entry: When 15-min RSI(7) of ETH/BTC > 70 on the spike

exit_conditions.take_profit: Return to pre-spike ETH/BTC ratio level
exit_conditions.stop_loss: ETH/BTC ratio continues rising >1.5% beyond entry

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Less than 60% of signals fully retrace to pre-spike levels within 6 hours OR average retracement <80% of initial move.
